attributes.action: Legalise the importation, sale and consumption of coca tea in the United Kingdom
attributes.background:
Coca tea is a safe, healthy and natural herbal tea that would be beneficial to UK consumers.

The 2016 United Nations General Assembly Special Session on Drugs (UNGASS2016), to be held on the 19th-21st April, offers the unique opportunity to open up debate on the issue.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information please visit the following:

Transnational Institute - Coca leaf: Myths and Reality

http://www.druglawreform.info/en/issues/unscheduling-the-coca-leaf/item/262-coca-leaf-myths-and-reality

APPG for Drug Policy Reform - Coca leaf: A political Dilemma?

https://www.unodc.org/documents/ungass2016//Contributions/Civil/APPG_for_Drug_Policy_Reform/Coca_Report_final_25_Sept.pdf

attributes.action: Introduce topics about gender equality and racial equality to the curriculum.
attributes.background: School is supposed to provide people an education so that they be ready for the 'real world'. What is the point when people aren't educated on social justice matters? The lack of education on racial and gender issues leaves a lot of people growing up with narrow-minded and ignorant opinions.
attributes.additional_details: I know first hand that the majority of boys in school will continue to think it is acceptable to objectify and show little respect to girls. In addition, many of the students will think it is okay to make racist remarks because they don't know any better. There is a platform that reaches these students' minds and can influence their thinking. We need to make it so they won't leave school uneducated on basic respect and social issues.

attributes.action: Scrap Air Passenger Duty (APD) on all UK flights
attributes.background:
Air Passenger Duty (APD) is the UK Government tax that is currently being charged on all passengers departing from a UK airport. Which since introduction in 1994, has risen by up to 539%.

Abolishing APD would see a significant increase in the UK’s GDP as well as the creation thousands of jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK ranks 137th out of 138 when it comes to air ticket taxes and charges - 2015 World Economic Forum’s Travel and Tourism Competitiveness Report.

Only six EU countries levy a similar tax, but with substantially lower rates than those in the UK.

The high charges of APD are severely hindering economic growth in the UK's Transport and Leisure Industry. In order to boost economic growth and improve competitiveness in the market, I urge the UK government to scrap APD.

attributes.action: Make the AA49 (wolverhampton) 70mph again.
attributes.background: The A449 has scrapped the national speed limit and has been replaced by a 50/60 mph speed limits. I see this as a pure waste of money and a great way to sting motorists with speed fines. I believe that it should be made a 70mph again.

attributes.action: ASPA'86 revised to ban use of animal testing and selling of tested goods in UK.
attributes.background: Since 1882 the use of animal testing has been reduced. But when the media states a reduction, it compares from the horrific state of which we treated animals to a position where we were only capable of improvement. In this age, 2016, is it still acceptable for this inhumane act to continue?
attributes.additional_details:
Most figures displayed by the media do not include animals that are bred for the purpose of testing and for use of tissue
then discarded or rejected because their genetic modifications did not work.
Use of animals:
Rodents 84%
Fish, amphibians, reptiles 12%
Large mammals 2.1%
Small mammals 1.4%
Dogs and cats 0.3%
Primates 0.1%
Scientists suggest that new drugs in development that act in very specific ways in the body may lead to more animals (specifically primates) being used in future years.

attributes.action: Reduce number of Constituencies by 20% to achieve savings in Goverment spending.
attributes.background: The chancellor has confirmed that additional cuts are required in his recent Budget. As this must be shared equally, parliament itself must cut costs. Elected MPs should represent larger numbers and areas and be excluded from  having additional employments which may affect their elected obligations.

attributes.action: Remove loophole allowing under aged girl married to an adult to live or be in UK
attributes.background: A current loophole in UK law allows young girls who married an aged man to circulate free in UK when married outside the UK. Sign this petition to remove this loophole and protect children by making this type of marriage completely illegal in UK.

attributes.action: DVLA to review their policies of exemption circumstances for medical conditions
attributes.background: DVLA legislations states that people who are monocular are exempt from exceptional circumstances in their medical section.
attributes.additional_details: I was born with one eye and head neck and facial disfigurement I had driven for 30 years I was legal to drive until DVLA changed their policies in 2013. The condition is congenital and is a non degenerative condition. Therefore the only change is DVLA policies. The machine (esterman vision test) that DVLA use to assess people's vision for driving was not designed to assess people's ability to drive it was to detect glaucoma. Due to my disfigurement the machine isn't fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Reject proposals to increase Insurance Premium Tax
attributes.background: The Chancellor may use the budget to increase insurance premium tax (IPT) as he did last year. This may seem an obscure tax but it will heavily  impact those paying the highest premiums already - the young and those who live in high risk areas - often the people least able to afford any increase.
attributes.additional_details: In the last budget the Chancellor increased IPT from 6% to 9.5%. Rumours are taht he may increase it a further 3% which would put £37 on the average car insurance premium. It would also increase home, pet and medical insurance as well as car breakdown cover. It is a pernicious tax because, while it affects everyone, it disproportionately affects the young and those who live in high risk areas who are least likely to be able to afford it.

attributes.action: Make Parking free for doctors in NHS.
attributes.background: At present every doctor has to pay £1.50 per day parking minimum to park their vehicle to come to work. Monthly £45/- to park in place of work in hospital which should be free.
attributes.additional_details: The argument by government is that more people should travel by public transport but the argument against it is that the doctors have to work odd hours of day and night so they need to travel by personal transport if they have one which is not only more convenient then public transport at odd hours especially but also saves time if public transport is not available near to their destinations also the travel by public transport increases the expense exponentially.

attributes.action: Clean slate for juvenile offences commited before 18 years old. A second chance
attributes.background: I believe it's unfair to hold mistakes people make as a minor/juvenile to stay with them for the rest of their life. The DBS filtering systerm is simply not good enough, they have been judged already lets not keep judging them 20 years later.
attributes.additional_details: I feel a more fair systerm should be in place. Low level offenders who have not ever served a custodial sentance should be able to move past their mistakes and not have a lack of judgement follow them for life. I propose if an offender does not re-offend between the ages of 18-21 by the time they are 21 other then DNA and fingerprints no record should be held about the young person in regards to arrests and convictions.

attributes.action: Reduce the minimum drinking age of low ABV alcoholic beverages to 16.
attributes.background: The minimum age for all alcoholic beverages is currently 18. This should be lowered to 16 for drinks that contain less than 10% alcohol by volume, in order to teach youths to drink responsibly. This is successful in Germany, where it is legal to purchase low alcohol containing beverages at 16.

attributes.action: Cut F35 orders for RN and replace them with a capable air superiority fighter
attributes.background: The F35 is not capable of being an Air Superiority fighter and would put Royal Navy pilots at a high risk of loss in air combat situations against super sonic soviet era jets with modern avionics packages.The Royal Navy needs carrier based fighters capable of defeating Sukhoi and Mikoyan (mig) Jets.
attributes.additional_details: The F35 is not capable of dog fighting and is not suitable for providing a close air superiority role. It has been beaten by the F16 jet in close air combat situations and dog fights, this aircraft has been built since the 1970's. This shows just how bad of a multi-role jet it is. It is to expensive for what it is and would save the government and tax payers millions by canceling a large amount of orders.These canceld orders should be replaced by the better Dassault Rafale M or F18 Super Hornet

attributes.action: Consider upping the drinking age to 21
attributes.background: This is to tackle the booze culture in this country where young people go out at weekends, get absolutely wasted and then have fights at 3am in the streets.
attributes.additional_details: Most people do like to return to a local pub culture and away from the thousands of bars that only serve to get people as drunk as possible. Also, It would still be a good idea to revert drinking hours back to what we had previously with traditional last orders closing times. After all, it's necessary to manage this problem that we are having in this country. With threatening refugee crisis, it's becoming more and more dangerous to stand by all soft laws should we protect our citizens. Do it now

attributes.action: Make prenuptial agreements legally binding
attributes.background: Prenuptial agreements are not legally binding in the UK, making divorce a financial burden, rather than an emotional burden.

attributes.action: I would like you to debate security on all schools in the uk
attributes.background: The Jewish community have now put security In their schools and neighbourhood. This must be a very big concern to take such action. This is the world we live in now........

attributes.action:
Referendum to any change from Human Rights Act to 
British Bill of Rights
attributes.background: British people should have their say as to which one they want. That's all the British people who should have the right to decide, and not just the 36% that voted for this government. It was British lawyers that set up the Human Rights Act and it is there to protect us.
attributes.additional_details:
This government wants to take some of our rights away.
1) The Worker's Rights Directive - this will go and allow Employers to make us work longer hours for less money.
2) The Court of Human Rights will go. It would be harder for us to get justice.

These are just two. There could be many more rights that we could lose if the government goes ahead and put in a British Bill of Rights without the whole of the British people decide in a referendum.

attributes.action: Change school admissions for SEN or disabled children.
attributes.background: Because parents find it increasingly difficult to choose a school under another authority even if that school is closer to the child's home. There is not enough done to support patents especially if non of the schools in the child's current LA are suitable or not where you wish your child to go.
attributes.additional_details: My own experience I am having a severely hard time at the minute trying to get my SEN child who should be attending a special needs school in September we are constantly been pushed away from our chosen school from our current LA because it's in the next LA even though the school is more suited to our daughter she loved it there on an open day and it is 1.3 mile away from home. No one from the LA is willing to help despite it being our request of school it's wrong and it needs to be adjusted

attributes.action: Close the Westminster Parliament if Britain votes yes in the EU referendum.
attributes.background: As the European Union would be making all the decisions regarding Britain a national parliament is an expensive entity no longer required.

attributes.action: Make the hosting and running of revenge porn sites a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Although its illegal to upload the photos to the site the hosting and running of the sites isn't illegal meaning nude photos can be viewed by thousands without the owners consent.  This can also lead to vulgar, demoralizing comments.
attributes.additional_details: Anna Richardson did an hour long documentry titled 'revenge porn' where she interviews victims and perpertrators of the revenge porn community.

attributes.action: Stop poaching healthcare professions from 3rd world and poorer nations.
attributes.background: NHS trusts nationwide frequently poach healthcare staff from third world; developing and poorer Eastern European nations. They are doing this to meet the training shortfall in this country and because it is much cheaper alternative to training domestic staff; causing a shortfall in these countries.
attributes.additional_details: The shortfall in the countries from where the staff are poached leaves the local populations exposed to the consequences of a shortage of doctors, nurses and other healthcare professionals. This will inevitably include morbidity and death in these populations. The nations spend a significant proportion of their GDP on training these staff only for them to be stollen by bribes by our own NHS. This must stop.

attributes.action: Make pointing a laser at an aircraft punishable by going on the no fly list.
attributes.background: Too many pilots are having lasers pointed at them as a joke. This can blind them and ruin a career that could be someone's dream job. They have probably spent years training and invested a lot of money. People who do this need to see the consequences. They shouldn't be allowed on an aircraft.

attributes.action: Protect our ageing workforce
attributes.background: With the increasing age for retirement all employers with over 25 staff on site should employ qualified medically trained staff with equipment ie defibrillators ect, and be able to hold surgeries in working hours,so you can have advice and check ups. The cost paid for by government and employers.

attributes.action: Change specialist schools starting age for disabled children.
attributes.background: last year my son was diagnosed with autism,changing our lives forever. After research and many phone calls I discovered that if a child cannot attend a mainstream school they can't attend a specialist school till reception age of 5!
attributes.additional_details: Doesn't a child with additional needs need intervention sooner rather then later? Us as parents need that help! In my son's situation starting school earlier rather then later can have a huge impact on his communication and social skills with out a shadow of a doubt..why should disabled children be left behind? Because of shortage of funding maybe? I don't know but I do know that families like mine need that stability and routine to start at age 3 not 5! Thanks for your time

attributes.action:
Give Council Tax Payers the option to OPT OUT of some service
elements
attributes.background: I believe every household or business that pays Yearly Council Taxes should have the right to OPT OUT of paying for services not required.

attributes.action: Regulate rip off student accommodation companies and their extortionate prices
attributes.background: Call on rip off student housing companies who charge extortionate rates, tie you into a contract which is too long for the academic year and who continue to rise their prices! Student loans do not get any bigger, tuition fees do not get any lower. Student housing companies need to be regulated.
attributes.additional_details: An average room in a 5 bed student house in Birmingham costs £110 a week per person per week, totalling £2200 per month. However, the same house would cost £1300 per calendar month for a professional. Students are the ones who need reasonable prices as their loans have other living costs to cover and it is impossible without help from parents. Other halls of residences charge even higher prices, with around £130 per week being the cost for a single bedroom and this is still rising!

attributes.action: Lower the age to buy cigarettes to 16.
attributes.background: Why do i have the option to fight for my country before i can buy a pack of fags its just stupid like a understand not lowering the drinking age but no ones going to smoke ten snout n get mwi off cigspin n start fighting at the weekend.

attributes.action: Provide free basic television and radio for patients in hospitals.
attributes.background: Currently many patients are charged for television whilst in hospital and for many patients it is costly.  Free radio and television would stop the burden of the cost and the complexity of setting it up.

attributes.action: Pass an Act of Parliament guaranteeing the asylum of Julian Assange.
attributes.background: Julian Assagne has had to seek refugee in the Ecuadorian embassy in London. Now that the UN has said that Assange has been declared to be in arbitrary detention. I call on the UK government and MP's to pass an Act of Parliament to protect him from deportation and thus grant him asylum in the UK.

attributes.action: Introduce Road Safety Cameras that reward safe driving while discouraging unsafe
attributes.background: Problem is speeding traffic. The Road Safety Camera would do two things. It would capture speeders and issue penalties in the usual way but with an amount of the fine going into a fund pot; then if you are obeying the speed you are entered into a draw to win some of that fine money from the speeders
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.thefuntheory.com/speed-camera-lottery-0
http://gamificationofwork.com/2011/10/the-speed-camera-lottery/
http://thegovlab.org/wiki/Stockholm_Speed_Camera_Lottery_(The_Fun_Theory)

attributes.action: Gather international support to pressure Saudi Arabia to stop funding Wahabbism.
attributes.background: Saudia Arabia has openly funded Wahabbism since the 1970s. Wahabbism is the extremist branch of Islam that promotes terrorism and jihad. This government should seriously rethink its relationship with Saudi Arabia and garner international support to stop the spreading of this destructive ideology.

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Services should penalise applicants who misuse the service
attributes.background: At present Child Maintenance Services only panalise the paying parent, There are no penalties for applicants who purposely abuse the service (see additional details below)
attributes.additional_details: Where an applicant has purposely witheld the child(ren) from a loving parent, and the paying parent has asked to have access or shared care and has shown evidence to have tried to arrange a private arrangement to provide for the childs needs but the applicant has deliberately choosen to withold the child in order to profit from child maintenance, then they should be fined £1000 and made to pay the money back where the courts rule in favour of the parent seeking custody

attributes.action: Discounted Stamp Duty for First Time Buyers + Include Essex for HTB ISA £450k.
attributes.background: Unfair discrimination for FT Buyers in Essex. No house value is below 250k for Stamp Duty. Also Help to Buy ISA unfair threshold of £250k in Essex doesn't get buy you anything. Essex has similar house prices to London
attributes.additional_details: Average house price in Essex well above Stamp duty and help to buy threshold. This needs to be discussed.

attributes.action: Jail for 30 days if you leave pets/children unnattended in cars on a hot day.
attributes.background: The amount of people leaving their pets in hot cars on a summers day is insane. People know the dangers but dont seem to care. I propose a minimum jail term of 30 days for people who commit this act against animals or children.
attributes.additional_details: evidence is everywhere

attributes.action: Make more treatments available on the NHS for Lipoedema patients.
attributes.background: Lipoedema is a genetic adipose tissue disorder which causes patients legs & arms to grow largely out of proportion. This can be an incredibly painful, embarrassing & debilitating condition. It's estimated to affect 11% of women worldwide
attributes.additional_details: The only way to effectively treat this condition is surgery. It doesn't just effect women, lipoedema can effect men as well. Patients with Lipoedema have painful, enlarged, lumpy, misshaped and often badly bruised arms and legs. Currently patients are left to suffer as the disfiguration of the limbs becomes more pronounced, the pain increases and their mobility and enjoyment of everyday activities decreases. Please sign this petition and get the Lipoedema patients the treatment they deserve.

attributes.action: Lowering the state pension age for women born in the 50s back to 60 years old.
attributes.background: My mother was born on the 10th december 1953, if she was born 4 days earlier she would have retired 2 and half years ago. I'm sure a lot of the country is in the same situation. There wasn't enough time for people born in the 50s to save. This needs to change back to the state pension age of 60.

attributes.action: Ban people working when temperature goes over 30C or 27C in a physical job
attributes.background:
Bring in a law were employers have to send home employees when temperature goes over 30C or 27C when working in a physical job

There is no guideline on being sent home if the work place gets too hot, working in a too hot enviroment can cause dehydration and risk of fainting

attributes.action: Stop all Police cuts within the UK and increase high visibility patrols.
attributes.background: We need more police officers on the streets not police cuts

attributes.action: Make the title nutritionist protected
attributes.background: there are many people out there that call them selfs a Nutritionist  however quite a few of them do not hold any degree that gives them the right to be called one let alone to work as one, some people tend to do a few day course which  this will allow them to give nutrition advice out to people
attributes.additional_details:
due to these few days  courses  which people do this causes a knock on effect on our jobs as a nutritionist also this puts people health at risk due to the advice that gets given is incorrect on a few accounts. 

make our title protected like the dietetics is protected

attributes.action: Designated vape only areas where not permitted in doors
attributes.background: People have taken on "vaping" to give up smoking and to have a cleaner healthier lifestyle, some pubs and places of work alow vaping in doors and welcome it where as others do not, then in most cases vapours are forced to use smoking areas exposing themselves to the chemicals and toxins
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see designated vaping areas in places that have designated smoking areas where vaping is not permitted in doors. I don't think its fair that vapers are being exposed to cigarette smoke. They have taken up vaping from smoking for a healthier lifestyle and to have smokers and vapers together in one area is not ideal. I would like to see vapers have same rights as smokers but treated separately.

attributes.action: Condemn dismissal of judges by Turkish authorities following military coup
attributes.background: Turkish authorities have reacted to the military coup by dismissing nearly 3000 judges around the country. This is a clear victimisation of members of the legal profession and is a disproportionate measure which will impact on administration of justice.

attributes.action: Train operators should provide more rolling stock to give all commuters a seat
attributes.background: Train operators habitually operate trains with 4 carriages at peak times causing dangerous levels of overcrowding. Many at non-peak times have up to 12 nearly empty carriages.  They justify this to get rolling stock into position. If they were to invest in enough stock this wouldn't be necessary.
attributes.additional_details: This is self evident to thousands of commuters who use the trains everyday and put up with poor customer service. Part of the franchise should enforce investment in rolling stock to fully meet peak demand.

attributes.action: Make discrimination of tattoos/piercings in the workplace a criminal offence
attributes.background: People shouldn't be discriminated against for their tattoos or piercings because it doesn't affect your quality/quantity of work. It's the same as discriminating against someone for their hair/eye/skin colour.
attributes.additional_details: Many people are discriminated against for their tattoos/piercings and a lot of people are rejected jobs because of them. body art doesn't affect the way someone works or how much someone works. so why are tattoos and piercings such a problem in the workplace?

attributes.action: To force all large retail outlets to buy British produce first at a fair price
attributes.background: With more and more produce available in the UK, why do we need to import 100's of tons of fruit and veg. I don't mind buying wonky carrots or odd shape veg, as long as it supports our farming/fishing industry. We need to support our own producers first.

attributes.action: A vote of no confidence in Boris Johnson as the UK's foreign secretary.
attributes.background: Boris Johnson has consistently demonstrated a lack of awareness towards Europe and the rest of the world. Why would we, citizens of the United Kingdom allow this man to represent us in Europe and the rest of the world as our foreign secretary?

attributes.action: Refuse entry to the refugees currently held up in Calais camps when they close
attributes.background:
There are currently over 5000 refugees camping at Calais. Natacha Bouchart plans to demolish these camps and send these people to the UK. She says this will happen "very soon". 
Our country is not capable of such numbers nor are we a soft touch.
This is not our problem.
attributes.additional_details:
Read the story here about the impending demolishing of the camps. 
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/calais-mayor-says-brexit-means-8408236?utm_content=buffercbf60&utm_medium=social&utm_source=facebook.com&utm_campaign=buffer

attributes.action: Ban the funding of political parties by any individual, company or organisation.
attributes.background:
Instead, all parties which command a minimum membership, should receive an identical sum from the state for all promotional activities. All eligible parties should be funded by the taxpayer. 

Accepting funding in any form from a third party would become a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details:
This would ensure that strong leaders with vision become the loudest voices, rather than those with financial backing from vested interests.

The Conservatives would cease to be hijacked by the interest of big business and lobby groups and Labour would cease to be highjacked by the Unions. 

There would be a genuinely level playing field which would encourage radical, positive change.

Only then can we create a political system that is truly representative - and one that we can all be proud of.

attributes.action: cap the price of household line rental to £10.00 a month.
attributes.background: over £200. per year in line rental charges by service providers, thats before any other charges are made,, it needs to be capped at £10.00.

attributes.action: Guarantee the estimated £3.8 million of HLS funding for the New Forest.
attributes.background:
There will be a £3.8 million gap in funding for the New Forest Higher Level Stewardship Scheme for 2019 and 2020 once the UK officially leaves the EU.

The scheme is vital to protecting the New Forest's unique environment. That's why we're calling on the government to continue funding the scheme.
attributes.additional_details:
The New Forest Higher Level Stewardship Scheme is a formal partnership between the Verderers, the Forestry Commission and the New Forest National Park Authority.

It has:
Restored miles of internationally-important habitats for wildlife
Supported the historic practice of commoning, which maintains the unique Forest landscape
Worked to identify & protect historic sites

New Forest Commoners: http://www.nfcda.com/news--meetings.html
Official page: http://www.hlsnewforest.org.uk/hls/site/index.php

attributes.action: Immediately raise the minimum wage by 10% to counteract the slump in the pound
attributes.background: People on minimum wage - especially those like myself aged between 18 and 21 - struggled to make ends meet as things were. With all imported products risen in price by 10% due to the slump in the pound, we need some support. We the undersigned call on the government to raise NMW by 10%.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the result of the EU referendum, the pound has dropped by more than 10% against the euro and dollar, increasing the price of all imported goods. It is forecast to drop further. This affects those on lower wages a considerable amount. As I am currently being paid £5.30 an hour, any increase in costs could make me unable to support myself. I fear that I may fall into debt and/or become a burden on the state - this is not something I would like to happen to myself or others in my position.
